name: Lenus
sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.

attributes.attribute: invoked as the ancestral god of the Treveri tribe
Statues show him standing next to a large Bird, perhaps a Goose
juxtaposition may indicate his own powers or his partnering with a goose goddess

text: A Celtic god known as Lenus was worshipped both on the continent and in the British Isles. Specifically, the Treveri tribe considered him to be their ancestral deity. Statues of Lenus portray him standing alongside a notable bird - rumored to be a goose - which could symbolize his own abilities, or the fact that he was coupled with a goddess associated with these birds.
